div.h1: Activities Calendar - Click on "Calendar" below to view all scheduled activities

div.span: If you are having trouble viewing the document, you may download the document.

span.strong: FBLA SLC Opening Session will be live on the Missouri web site http://missourifbla.org/on Tuesday, April 21 @ 7 pm. Awards of Excellance TBA.
Otterville FBLA Cookie Dough fundraiser pick-up is Tuesday, April 28th at the designated times below. All orders must be picked up Tuesday. Thank you, Mrs. B

In an effort to recruit and retain highly qualified teachers for our students, the Otterville RVI Board of Education approved a 4 day school week for the 2020-2021 school year with a start date of August 25, 2020. School will not be in session on Mondays. Final calendar will be approved at the March BOE Meeting and will be released shortly after. We greatly appreciate all of the communication, feedback and support of our community.
Anyone interested in providing childcare in their homes next year is welcome to submit your contact information to Mrs. Beltz at cbeltz@ottervillervi.k12.mo.us

We are not endorsing any one person or persons, however, we would like to share out information for you to the community to support those in need of childcare next school year. These listings will be shared in the next newsletter. Please share with Mrs. Beltz by March 15th to be included in the list.
Pick -Up Procedure Information

For the safety of all students and staff, as well as a reduction in interruptions in classrooms. Beginning March 2nd, the doors will not open until 5 minutes til 3:00p.m. for parents who are picking up students. When you are able to enter at 5 til 3:00, please DO NOT go past the benches in the hallway. Parents are not to go to classrooms, as instruction and end of day routines need to not be interrupted. Thank you!

span.span: Notice of Candidate Filing Information for the Board of Education can be found HERE

span.strong: The art students have been busy! Below you will find the 1st-3rd place Otterville Street Fair Posters as well as the 4th place piece in colored pencil from the Junior High Kaysinger Art Contest.
Street Fair Poster Contest:
1stPlace-Drew Cook
2ndPlace-Jazmine Blackmore
3rdPlace and Peoples Choice-Christian Bremer
Junior High Kaysinger Conference Art Contest:
Jenna Halter-4thPlace in Color Pencil
Announcements for the upcoming 2019-2020 School Year
Open House will be held on Monday, August 19 from 5:00pm to 7:00pm.
Fallsports parent meeting will be held on August 19 at 7:00pm in the cafeteria.
The first day of school will be Wednesday, August 21st. School start time has changed to 8:02. Breakfast will be served beginning at 7:40am.

strong.span: SCHOOL PICTURE DAY IS MONDAY, AUGUST 26th!

span.strong: Ben Morisson campaigning and earning the vote to become the 2019-2020 FBLA National North Central Region Vice President. Congratulations Ben, and a job well done by his campaign manager Isaiah Gilmore and team Cyrus Gilmore.
Missouri FFA Chapter Officers participate in LEAD Training

p.span: To learn more about the LEAD program click HERE.

Otterville Future Business Leaders of America Chapter members attended District 6 Contest on Friday, February 1, 2019 at Moberly Area Community College. District 6 Officer from Otterville for 2018-19 was Kit Thompson Secretary. The results are listed:
Business Financial Plan 1st - Halle Draffen, Carrie McKinney, Josie Neal
Introduction to Business Procedures - 4th Alana Fletcher
District 6 Contest Ratings Not Advancing on to State
Publication Design 2nd Jermiah Hampton, James Kroeker, Oralia Spellmeyer, Ben Morrison
Emerging Business Issues 4th Laila Azuara, Alissa Malone, Mason Mateja
Introduction to Public Speaking 4th Noah Saltsgaver
Newly elected officers from the Otterville Chapter to District 6 are:
Vice President of Membership Ben Morrison
Vice President of FBLA-PBL Relations Noah Saltsgaver
Vice President of Communications Oralia Spellmeyer
Assisting Mrs. Cindy Birdwell, Adviser; was Kathy Thompson and Russ Slocom. FBLA State Leadership Conference will be held April 14-16, 2019 in Springfield, MO.

Chapter members participating in contest were: Bailey Sims, Truxton Tonasunu, Mark Oleynik, Cyrus Gilmore, Isaiah Gilmore, Bailee Vinson, Nicole Kroeger, Abby Nichols, Ava Norman, Nick Schaller, Noah Saltsgaver, Lillian Lee, Kylie Lawson, Alana Fletcher, Delaney Fry, Ben Morrison, Halle Draffen, Carrie McKinney, Josie Neal, Loren rocket, Christian Bremer, Mason Mateja, Alissa Malone, Victoria Cooper, Alexis Lee, Grace Thompson, Ashley Catron, Jeremiah Hampton, Laila Azuara, Crystal Vang, James Kroeker, Oralia Spellmeyer, and Kit Thompson

div.span: Notice of Non-Discrimination Otterville R-VI School Disrict does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disibility, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. Kim Oelrichs, Superintendent, 101 W Georgetown Street, Otterville, MO 65348 has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies. Please call the school at 660-366-4391 ext. 400 in regards to questions.
